channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Americans May Not Agree on Much, but They Agree Biden Made the Right Choice
item.description: The president’s decision to exit the race received overwhelming support. Only a few other things have drawn as much consensus in polling.

item.title: Olympics Live Updates: Arson Attack Triggers Travel Chaos Ahead of Opening Ceremony
item.description: At least three high-speed links to Paris were disrupted, causing widespread delays affecting about 800,000 travelers, the French national rail company said.

item.title: Hollywood video game performers are going on strike because they worry studios could train AI to copy them
item.description: The move comes after nearly two years of negotiations with gaming giants, including divisions of Activision, Warner Bros. and Walt Disney, over a new interactive media agreement.

item.title: The New Race
item.description: We explain three key points about the coming election.

item.title: These Are the French Rail Lines Affected by the Arson Attacks
item.description: The arson has caused widespread travel disruptions in France ahead of the opening ceremony of the Olympics.

item.title: Kamala Harris can rebuild the crypto bridges burned by Biden—but time is of the essence
item.description: Two progressive Democrats have some advice for their party's soon-to-be Presidential nominee.

item.title: Park Fire Spreads Rapidly in Northern California
item.description: One man is being held without bail after a witness saw him push a flaming vehicle down an embankment on Wednesday, the authorities said. The Park fire has burned more than 164,000 acres.

item.title: Will These Sensational Skateboarding Tricks Win Japan Olympic Gold?
item.description: They have landed some of the most difficult tricks in the history of skateboarding. But in Paris, they may have a problem.

item.title: Unilever customers swallowing ‘carry-over pricing’ from historic inflation helped it generate $6.4 billion in profits so far this year
item.description: The Ben & Jerry's owner says its starting to see negative pricing in some markets, but Europeans are still absorbing the group's rising costs.

item.title: These Are the French Rail Lines Affected by the Arson Attacks
item.description: The arson has caused widespread travel disruptions in France ahead of the opening ceremony of the Olympics.

item.title: The Olympics You Remember Are Back
item.description: Family, friends and fans were missing from two straight Covid Games. In Paris, one athlete said, competitors will have the kind of experience they dream about.

item.title: Spain poised to become Europe’s data center capital as Amazon and Meta invest billions to kickstart development
item.description: Developing more industries and businesses in emptier regions in Spain is a major common goal across the political aisle.

item.title: Arson Disrupts Olympics Travel, and Obama Endorses Harris
item.description: Plus, top Mexican cartel leaders arrested.

item.title: Is 100 Days Enough Time to Pick a Leader? Around the World, Yes.
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris may run the shortest presidential campaign in modern U.S. history. But in many democracies, it’s plenty of time.

item.title: Empty nesters are sad to see their kids leave the house. They can be even more distressed when they return home
item.description: Why grown kids moving back home can be a big adjustment for parents.
